title: Update Dockerfile to install Python 3.6
body_html:
The Python 3 containers at gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow generated by tensorflow/tools/docker are currently built using Python 3.5.

It would be nice to update them to Python 3.6 instead, which I think would be as simple as adding sudo apt-get install python3.6.

  • Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): N/A
  • OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): N/A
  • TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): N/A
  • TensorFlow version (use command below): N/A
  • Python version: N/A
  • Bazel version (if compiling from source): N/A
  • GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): N/A
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A
  • GPU model and memory: N/A
  • Exact command to reproduce: N/A

body:
The Python 3 containers at gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow generated by [tensorflow/tools/docker](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/docker) are currently built using Python 3.5.

It would be nice to update them to Python 3.6 instead, which I think would be as simple as adding `sudo apt-get install python3.6`.

- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow)**: N/A
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: N/A
- **TensorFlow installed from (source or binary)**: N/A
- **TensorFlow version (use command below)**: N/A
- **Python version**: N/A
- **Bazel version (if compiling from source)**: N/A
- **GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source)**: N/A
- **CUDA/cuDNN version**: N/A
- **GPU model and memory**: N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**: N/A
